quote: Captain's Log, Stardate 46192.3.   We have arrived at Starbase   one-one-two and are loading relief   supplies destined for Tagra Four,   an ecologically devastated planet   in the Argolis Cluster. We have   also taken on a rather unusual   passenger.
Welcome to the Enterprise. We're   delighted to have you aboard.
Thank you, Sir.
Congratulations. I understand   you were selected from among   hundreds of applicants for this   internship.
Yes, sir. I still can't believe   they chose me... there were lots   of people with better records...
Your transcript is very   impressive...       She's done honors work in   neurobiology, plasma dynamics,   and eco-regeneration. I'd call   that pretty well-rounded.
That's a nice way of saying I   haven't made up my mind about   what I want to do with my life.
I've arranged to have you work   in all the major departments while   you're here. I'm willing to bet   that by the time it's over you'll   have a pretty good idea what field   you're interested in.
Or at least what fields you're not   interested in.
Come.
We're bringing up the last of the   cargo, sir. We should be ready   to leave within the hour.
Commander, would you escort Ms.   Rogers to her quarters? I have   to discuss the Tagran's medical   needs with Doctor Crusher.
You've won yourself a rare   opportunity. Avail yourself of   it.
I will, sir.
It'll take a few days before you   know your way around. If you   ever need help just use one of   the companels...
We're on deck seven, section...       Four?
That's right.
I practically memorized the specs   on the way here.
You're a quick study.
This is it.
Is this for me?
All yours.
It's so... big.
For honor students, only the best.
I could've brought The Zoo.
The zoo?
That's what my parents call it.   Three dogs isn't so many, is it?
Depends how they get along.
I'd have a dozen, but my mother   said enough is enough.
I'm sure going to miss them.
We'll try and keep you so busy   you won't have time to.       I'd better be going; I have to get   back to the Cargo Bay.
Thanks for walking me down.
Oh, no... I didn't mean it...
You can't be here... Go away.
All of you.
You too.
See these readouts? This is your   heart rate, your blood pressure...   all your vital signs.
You're in good shape.       You might just live to be my age.
All these tricorders have to be   tested before they get put in the   supply containers we're taking   to Tagra.
So I scan myself with each one   to make sure all the readouts are   working?
If they're not, put that unit   aside and we'll run a diagnostic   on it.
So I understand you were accepted   to the Academy... I have a son   there.
Being posted on the Enterprise,   I guess you don't get to see him   very often... ?
Not as often as I'd like.
Do you have any other children?
My husband died a number of years   ago. Wes was our only child.
Was he old enough to know his   father?
Jack died when he was five.
My parents died when I was a baby.   I don't remember anything about   them... Sometimes I wonder what   they were like.
I understand your adopted parents   are in Starfleet.
They're marine biologists... They   were just posted to the Bilaren   system.
Sickbay to Doctor Crusher... you   wanted to be told when the   cultures were ready.
On my way.       I have to go. When you've   finished with the tricorders,   Nurse Ogawa can help you take them   down to the Shuttlebay for   loading.
Okay.
Thanks for your help. We need   every spare hand we can get; this   is one of the biggest relief   efforts we've ever mounted.
Why are you taking everything down   in shuttlecraft?
We can't use the transporters   because of all the ionization in   the Tagran atmosphere.
From the barystatic filters?
How'd you know that?
I did a paper on eco-regeneration.
Then you know that a thousand   barystatic filters put out a lot   of ionization...
A thousand... ?
They've managed to pollute their   atmosphere pretty badly.
It's amazing... that they go to   such lengths to clean the air...   instead of regulating the   emissions that cause the problem.
You're right.
All the filters can do is keep   things from getting worse. They   shoot negative ions into the   planet's stratosphere --

-- where they come into contact   with airborne pollutants and   transfer their charge. The   filters have positively charged   intake vents that the pollutants   become attracted to; that sets   up a kind of ionic current in the   atmosphere.
(calling from across     the room)   Commander, are you all right?
Yeah... I didn't even see it   coming...
Come in.
Commander Riker told me you liked   dogs...
What's your name?
This is Henry.
Henry?
Don't ask me.
Where'd he come from?
Ensign Janklow is going to the   Gantol excavations for three   weeks. He's been trying to find   someone to take care of Henry.
I'll do it.
Okay. But be warned -- he has   an appetite for boots.
By the time Ensign Janklow gets   back I'll have Henry shaking   hands.
Doctor Crusher tells me you're   considering a career in zoology.
I was... but this morning I   decided to become a Starfleet   doctor... then by this afternoon   I realized I was really meant to   be a Chief Engineer.
What does a ship's counselor do?   Maybe that's what I'll want to   be by tomorrow.
There are just so many things I'm   interested in... sometimes I worry   that I'll never focus on just   one thing...
There's nothing wrong with keeping   your options open.

I'm just afraid I won't have   enough time for everything I want   to do. I mean --       -- there's school, and then   graduate study, and a career...   and of course I want to get   married and have children -- lots   of children -- and more animals...       Maybe I should study   agriculture... have a big farm   somewhere...
Amanda... whatever you choose,   I'm sure you'll be good at it.
I know one thing... I wouldn't   mind coming back to the Enterprise   when I graduate.
Who knows? Maybe you will.
-- this is the main control area.   We can access just about any   primary circuit from these panels.       That's a Jeffries tube over there   --
Where most of the major systems   conduits are routed.
You've done your homework.
It's hard to imagine how much   energy is being harnessed in   there...
Imagination is not necessary; the   scale is readily quantifiable.       We are presently generating twelve   point seven-five billion gigawatts   per second.
The temperature in the reaction   chamber has increased by   forty-seven percent.
The injector couplings are frozen   -- I can't slow the reaction...
Temperature increase is at one   hundred six percent... and rising.
La Forge To Bridge!
Picard, here.
We're heading for a core breach!   We're going to have to try and   vent the plasma!
Plasma inductors are not   responding.
We're going to lose containment...
Bring down the isolation door -   we have to eject the warp core.
Everybody out! Move it!
Temperature in the reaction   chamber is back to normal.
She's a little shaken up, but   she'll be all right.
You said she was adopted... could   she be an alien?
She's human... and there's nothing   unusual about her, not that my   instruments can detect.
Commander, have you been able to   determine the cause of the warp   breach?
No, sir. Everything was normal   and then... it's like the laws   of physics suddenly went out the   window.
And why not? They're terribly   inconvenient.
Mon Capitan.
Are you responsible for the   incident in Engineering?
Of course. I needed to find out   if what I suspected about the girl   was true.
That being?
That she's Q.
Amanda... is a Q... ?
How is that possible? Her   parents... her biological   parents... were human.
Not exactly.
They had assumed human form...   in order to visit Earth. For an   amusement, I suppose... but in   vulgar human fashion they   proceeded to conceive a child.
Then, like mawkish humans, they   became attached to it. What is   it about those squirming little   infants that you find so   appealing?
I'm sure that's beyond your   comprehension, Q.
I desperately hope so.
What happened to Amanda's parents?
They died in an accident. None   of us knew whether the child would   inherit the capacities of a Q...   but recently, they began to   emerge. As an expert on humanity   -- I was sent to investigate.
You, an expert on humanity... ?
Not a very challenging field of   study, I'll grant you...
Are you saying you caused the core   breach -- just to test her?
What if she hadn't been able to   stop it?
Then I would've known she wasn't   Q.
Now that you know, what do you   intend to do?
Instruct her, of course. If that   child doesn't learn how to control   her power... she could accidently   destroy herself. Or all of you.   Perhaps your entire galaxy.
Somehow I find it hard to believe   that you'd come here to do us a   favor...

You're quite right -- I wouldn't.   But there are those in the   Continuum who have an exaggerated   sense of responsibility... and   think we should take precautions   to keep the little dear from   running amuck.
And once you've taught her...   you'll go away?
And leave her here... when she's   Q? Of course not... she'll come   to the Continuum, where she   belongs.
Wait a minute... you can't just   come in here and take her away   from everything she's known...
I assure you, I can --
She has plans for herself... she   wants a career, a family --
I can rescue her from that   miserable existence.
That "miserable existence" is all   she's known for eighteen years.   You have no right to take it away   from her.
Mon Capitan... I really think we   need to speak privately.
There. Isn't that better? Doctor   Crusher gets more shrill with each   passing year...
What is it you really want, Q?   Why bring Amanda here... to the   Enterprise?
Where better than here, among my   dear friends? After all... you   know so much about the Q...   you're the perfect people to   introduce me to the child. Let   her know she can trust me.
Trust you -- !
Jean-Luc... you wound me...
I don't trust you and I certainly   wouldn't expect Amanda to.
She'd better -- because I'm all   she's got. She needs me to   prepare her... for her future with   the Q.
She may not want that future.   The decision is hers.
Yes, yes -- fine.       But do you really think she'll   want to remain a feeble mortal?

If Amanda is a Q... she'll need   to understand what that means.       I'll introduce you, but we cannot   continue to fight like this in   front of Amanda. For her sake,   we'll have to appear to be...
Pals?
Civil.
We need time to explain this   to her.
I knew I could count on you,   Jean-Luc.
Mister Data... I want you to   access any available records on   Amanda Rogers.
Yes, Captain.
I want to know more about her   biological parents... about their   death. I find it odd that any   Q could die in an accident.
It does not seem consistent with   what we know of them.
I'm convinced Q isn't telling   us everything. See what you can   find out.
Aye, sir.

It started happening about six   months ago... things I wished for   suddenly appearing... objects   moving on their own... I thought   I was going crazy...       In a funny way, finding this out   is kind of a relief.
I can understand that.       The person I mentioned... from   the Q Continuum... would like to   meet you. If you want to...
I'm ready.
There's my girl!
Amanda, this is Q.       He is...       ... an acquaintance of ours. We've   known him for years.
Very impressive the way you   contained that explosion. What   else have you done?
I... don't understand.
Telekinesis, teleportation,   spontaneous combustion of someone   you didn't like -- that sort of   thing.
I think what Q means to ask is...   have you deliberately used your   abilities... ?
Not until I came here. The first   time was when the container almost   fell on Commander Riker.
You did so well with that I   decided to give you a real   challenge... the warp core   breach.
She clearly has potential. I see   no reason why she can't come back   to the Continuum right now.
What?
I don't want to go anywhere...
Don't worry. With time you'll   be able to overcome the   disadvantages you suffered as a   child. No one will hold it   against you that you were human.
Captain Picard -- ?
Let's go, Amanda.
She doesn't want to --
Leave me alone! I'm not going   anywhere with you!
You agreed she has the right to   decide her own future... yet the   first chance you get you try to   abduct her.
You overreact as usual, Jean-Luc.   I assure you -- I was merely   testing her power. She's quite   a little spitfire, isn't she?
What's going on, Q? What's your   real purpose in being here?
I've made that quite clear. The   Continuum has a vested interest   in this young woman...
If you intend to protect that   investment, I suggest you approach   her differently.
She's just a little skittish.   She'll have to start behaving like   a Q.
If I'm not mistaken, she just did.
I don't want anything to do with   that Q person. I don't care about   having powers...
You understand, don't you? I have   things I want to do... I'm going   to the Academy... I want a career,   I want to join Starfleet...
You can still do those things...
But now it's so -- complicated.   This power I have... it's just   going to get in the way. I don't   want to have to deal with it...
But you have to.
I know how you feel. It would   be so much easier if none of this   had happened... if it would just   go away.       But it's not going to go away.
You need someone to help you.   And the person who can help you   -- is Q.
But he's horrible.
But he's the only one who can help   you understand who you are. There   are hard choices you're going to   have to make about your future...   and you can't make them by   ignoring the truth.
You're right.       But I don't want any of this to   disrupt my time here. I want to   do everything I'm expected to   do... and I don't want you to   treat me any differently.       Please?
You've got a deal. The first free   hour you have, report to me in   the medical lab. I have an   experiment I need help with.
Yes, ma'am.
Your progress, Q?
As anticipated there have been   some problems... but the humans   are cooperating. I need more   time.       There is a possibility we won't   have to terminate her.
Come in.
Hello, my dear...
I've been told that I behaved   badly. I...       ... a-pol-ogize...
Apparently you had every right   to chastise me...    (he's had enough of     groveling)   ... but what's done is done.   Right?
I'd like to ask you some   questions.
Anything...
What, exactly, are the Q?
It would be so much easier to show   you than to tell you. If you'd   just agree to take a short visit   to the Continuum --
No. Just tell me.
To put it simply... we are   omnipotent. There is nothing --   nothing -- we can't do.
And what do you do with this   power?
Whatever we want.
Do you use it to help others?
I think you've missed the point.   You've obviously spent far too   much time among humans.
As a Q, you can have your heart's   desire instantly... whatever it   might be. Would you like precious   jewels? Works of art? Would you   like to visit the rings of   Tautine?
I don't care about any of those   things.
Of course not. You're a Q. But   surely there is something you   want... something you never   dreamed would be possible...
What is it, Amanda? Just tell   me...
I've always wanted to see what   my parents looked like... my real   parents.
How quaint.       So do it.
What do you mean?
Summon the image.
But... I don't know how.
Think about them... evoke the   memory...
But --
Amanda. You can do this. Trust   me.
Close your eyes... concentrate...
In your mind, return to the time   when you were an infant... think   about your parents... try and   remember them... now, open your   eyes.
They look so happy...       They loved me...
Ten percent benasopil.
So I add thirty milliliters to   each of the cultures...
Twenty milliliters...
Right, twenty... I wait for it   to be metabolized... add --   another twenty?       ... wait for it to be   metabolized... over and over until   the bacilli can't absorb any more.
That's it.       Just be sure and record the rate   of mitosis in each dish.
Mitosis... right.
You seem a little distracted.
Well... I just saw my parents.   My real parents.
Q showed me how...
Can you imagine how that felt... ?
No... I don't think I can.
You were right... I can't ignore   what's happened to me...    (a beat as she fights     choking up)   ...but... I don't know if I can   cope with it.
You're stronger than you think,   Amanda...
When I looked at my parents...   right there, in front of me...   I realized -- I caused this to   happen.
I wanted to see them... and I did.       If it were you... if suddenly you   could have anything you wanted...   what do you think you'd do?
I have no idea --
No, think about it. Really think.   Suddenly you have the power to   do anything. What would it be?
I... I'm not sure. I'd probably   want to cure people... people who   were hopelessly ill.
Would you bring your husband back?
Oh, Amanda, I don't know... I   don't think I could decide about   something like that until I was   faced with it...
I am faced with it.
Go on with your work. I'll be   back to check on you later.
I thought she'd never leave.
I don't think I'll ever get used   to that...
It's time for another lesson.
I have to do this experiment   first.
What is it you're doing?
We're delivering live vaccine   bacilli to Tagra. I'm supposed   to find the best nutrient solution   for keeping them alive while   they're in stasis.
How fascinating...       I have a splendid idea. We'll   combine your work... with our   lesson. I'll show you how to   finish this in no time.
I think I'd better do it the way   Doctor Crusher showed me.
Why? I'm sure the Doctor would   be delighted if you could speed   things along. Think what it would   mean... you could handle double...   triple the work load.
Well... I guess so.
All right. As you look at the   tissue samples... form an image   of them in your mind...
Number One... Doctor Crusher has   some live vaccine bacilli for   delivery to Tagra... they'll need   to be shipped in a stasis field.   Will you make the arrangements?
I'll get right on it.
Captain, there is a message from   Tagra Four.
On screen.
Enterprise, I am Orn Lote,   Engineer. We are having   difficulties with the reactor that   powers our barystatic filters on   the southern continent. We may   have to shut it down for repairs.
Perhaps my Chief Engineer could   assist you... ?
I hope so. If we are forced to   disable the reactor, it would take   months to re-establish the ionic   currents the filters have formed   in the atmosphere.
Send us your design specifications   -- I'm sure we can do something.
Thank you, Captain.
Captain... may I see you for a   moment?
What is it, Mister Data?
I have some information regarding   Amanda Rogers' parents.
Records indicate that they died   in Topeka, Kansas.
Their home was destroyed during   a tornado.
A tornado? Why wasn't it   dissipated by the Weather   Modification Net?
Unknown, sir. The bodies were   found in the rubble after the   storm had passed.
See if you can find out any   details. I'd like to know more   about that storm.
Yes, Captain.
If it isn't Number Two...
(ignoring him; to     Amanda)   I'm looking for Doctor Crusher.   I don't know what nutrients she   wants to ship with the bacilli.
I'm not sure... I'll tell her to   contact you.
Thanks.
You could wait for her here... ?
If you wanted to...
Just tell her I'll be in   Shuttlebay Two.
You're attracted -- to him?
Of course not...
I think you are. How repulsive...   how can you stand that hair all   over his face?
Doctor... Commander Riker was   looking for you... he said he'd   be in Shuttlebay Two.
Thank you.
You've finished already?
How did you do it so quickly?
Q helped me... we did it in less   than half the time it would've   normally taken.

That explains this data.    (puts the Padd down,     addresses Q)   I needed to know the rates of   mitosis. By artificially   accelerating them you made the   experiment useless. Now I'll have   to do it over again.
I'm sorry, Doctor...
Don't be sorry. If she wants to   do things the hard way, that's   her business.
Why did you interfere with what   she was doing?
She's Q... making her plod through   human chores is an insult to her.
She has asked not to be treated   differently.
That doesn't mean you have to bore   her to death.
I don't interfere with what you're   trying to teach Amanda --
You wouldn't be capable of   interfering --
I don't think it's too much to   ask for you to do the same --
-- and you stay out of mine.
Now that you put it like that,   I think you're absolutely right.
Captain...
Yes, Mister Data?
I have more information regarding   the tornado that killed Amanda   Rogers' parents.
What is it?
It was unusually compact, yet   extremely powerful -- its recorded   wind velocity was characteristic   of a funnel three times its size.
Download the files to my Ready   Room. I'll study them in   there.
Yes, sir.
Doctor Crusher was only trying   to help me... you shouldn't have   turned her into a dog...
Now, be truthful, Amanda. Wasn't   it amusing?       Just a little?
(acknowledging, a little     smile)   Well...
There, you see? My dear, what's   the point of having these   abilities if you can't enjoy them?       Now -- have you been practicing   your teleportation?
Yes. But it's kind of hard. I   keep ending up somewhere I don't   want to be.
You're going to have to start   honing your abilities. It won't   do to be sloppy... let's see...   perhaps a little game?
I'm going to hide somewhere on   the ship... you try to find me.
But how do I know --
Don't worry, Amanda. You can do   it...
Not bad. Not bad at all.
The trick is to come up with a   field modulater that doesn't   require shutting down their   reactor...
If we use , we can devise   a mechanism that integrates into   the existing system while it is   in operation.
You're still thinking like a   human...
Now do you understand? What do   humans have to offer that even   begins to compare with that?
Your future contains wonders you   can't even imagine... the universe   could be your playground...
Doctor Crusher and Counselor   Troi... they're taking me to   dinner.
You don't have to eat, you know.   It's just a nasty human habit you   could easily do without.
Hello, Amanda. Are you ready?
Yes...
Is there something else you'd like   to order, Amanda?
No, thank you. I'm just... not   hungry.       Actually, I don't even have to   eat. It's a human trait.
I see.       How are you feeling about all this   now? It must be overwhelming.
It was at first. But now... I'm   actually enjoying myself.
Hello, ladies...
Hello, Wil...
Commander Riker... why don't you   join us?
Thanks, but I'm meeting someone.
How are the lessons going? Is   Q being patient with you?
What's this all about?
I thought it might be nice for   us to spend some time alone   together.
I think you should take us back   to Ten Forward.
Are you sure? Wouldn't you like   to be here with me for a while?
The moonlight is beautiful...   isn't it nicer here than in Ten   Forward?
It's very pleasant. But that's   not the point...
I think it is...
No...       You can't just snatch people away   and put them in your fantasies...   and expect them to respond.
Don't you like me... even a   little?
I think you're a lovely young   woman. But -- none of this is   real.
My feelings are real...
I know that... but -- you can't   make someone... love you.
Can't I?
Amanda...
You're so beautiful...
Do you love me?
Yes... more than anything...
You're right... none of this is   real...
I thought it would be romantic...   but it's empty...
Amanda...
Just go back to Ten Forward...
Bon jour, mon Capitan. You wanted   to talk to me?
Yes. I want to ask you about   Amanda's biological parents. When   they decided to remain on Earth,   what was the reaction in the   Continuum?
We found it incomprehensible.
Were they pressured to come back?   Were they threatened with   punishment if they didn't?
What are you getting at, Picard?
The circumstance of their death   was a bit odd... a tornado that   escaped the Weather Modification   Net... and then touched down in   only one spot -- Amanda's home.
You never can predict the   weather...

Tornadoes develop from existing   storm fronts... and there were   no storm fronts in Kansas that   day. Witnesses reported that the   funnel materialized   spontaneously... directly over   Amanda's home... destroyed it...   and then disappeared.
If you say so. I wasn't there.
Were Amanda's parents executed...   by the Q Continuum?
And what if they were?
Then I think Amanda has the right   to know that before she makes a   choice about her future.
Don't be foolish, Picard. She   has no choice. She never did.
If she is truly Q, she must come   where she belongs, to the   Continuum...
But if she is some kind of   hybrid... neither human nor Q...   then I'm afraid she'll have to   be...
Are you that despicable, Q?
Don't be naive. You have no idea   what it means to be Q. With   unlimited power comes the need   for responsibility. Do you think   we can allow an omnipotent being   to roam free in the universe?
And... what have you concluded?   Does she live... or does she die?
I haven't decided yet.
Captain's log, Stardate 46193.8.   We have arrived at Tagra Four and   have begun delivering supplies.   In the meantime, I am faced with   a crisis of a different nature.
I have no reason to believe Q is   lying. He has orders from the   Continuum... if Amanda doesn't   prove herself to be fully Q...   he must kill her.
We have to tell her...
I'm not sure we should... it seems   almost cruel.
Maybe she can protect herself...   after all, she has a great deal   of power.
So did her parents, and it didn't   save them.
I'm inclined to agree that Amanda   deserves to know the truth of the   situation. We don't have the   right to withhold such crucial   information.       But it won't be easy telling   her...
What's your impression of the   field modulator, Mister Lote?
Quite ingenious, quite ingenious,   indeed...       I'm amazed at the way it can be   incorporated into the existing   system.
We're all loaded. We can head   for the surface whenever you're   ready.
I'm eager to see the field   modulator in place, Commander.
Why don't we get going... ?
Kill me? Why?
They're not convinced you're fully   Q.
They were responsible for the   death of your parents...
My parents -- ?
What right do they have?
Answer that, Q. Or are you afraid   to face me?
You're such a plucky little thing.   I do enjoy you, you know.
Amanda's question deserves an   answer, Q. You've made yourself   judge, jury, and -- if necessary   -- executioner. By what right   do you appoint yourself to this   position?
Superior morality...
I recall how you used your   superior morality when we first   encountered you. You put us   on trial for the crimes of   humanity.
The jury is still out, Picard.   Make no mistake.

Your arrogant pretense to being   the moral guardians of the   universe strikes me as a bit pale   today. You have shown no evidence   that you are guided by a superior   moral code -- by any code   whatsoever. You may be nearly   omnipotent -- I won't deny your   parlor tricks are impressive --   but morality? No, I don't see   it. I don't acknowledge it. I   would put human morality against   the Q's any day.
Perhaps that's the fascination   we humans hold for you... ? That   by our puny example we give you   a glimmer of the one thing that   eludes your omnipotence -- a moral   center.
If so, I can think of no crueler   irony than for you to destroy   a young woman whose only crime...   is being too human.

Jean-Luc, Jean-Luc... sometimes   I think the only reason I come   here is to listen to these   wonderful speeches of yours. But   in this case your concerns are   unwarranted. We've decided not   to harm her. We're prepared to   offer her a choice.
What kind of choice?
You can come with me to the   Continuum --
The other choice is more   difficult.       You have within yourself the   ability to refrain from using the   power of Q. If you can do that   -- you can stay here.
Then I'm staying here.
Think carefully... it won't be   easy. Your parents were offered   the same choice... and they were   unable to resist using their   power.
All I've wanted... since this   whole thing began... was to be   a normal human being again. I   know I can resist.
Worf to Picard -- there is an   emergency message from Commander   Riker.
On my way.

Captain, the damage to the reactor   was greater than the Tagrans led   us to believe. The field   modulator is installed and   operational, but it's not going   to be enough... the reactor's gone   into overload...
Can you correct the problem?
La Forge is trying to stabilize   the unit now. We'll stay as long   as possible... there are thousands   of people in the area, and if that   reactor goes...
(on viewscreen, to     Riker)   Commander -- over here, quickly!
Is this your doing, Q -- ?
Not this time, Picard.
Mister Worf, see if there's   anything we can do to cut through   the interference and beam them   out of there.
Aye, sir.
Captain, La Forge is trying a   neutrino infusion. There's a   chance it'll smother the   reaction...

Commander... look at this...
This is impossible...
I don't know what's happening,   sir -- but the reaction is   stabilizing on its own.

On screen.
Atmospheric contaminants have   dropped to less than one part   per trillion.       The ecosystem has been restored   to its natural state.
Amanda... ?
You see? It's harder to resist   than you thought...
I couldn't let all those people   die...

Doctor Crusher... I've decided...   I can't stay...       I can't stay here.
